subject: Creativity
title: Jobs & Wozniak: The Visionary and the Engineer
description: A quick, practical guide to Jobs & Wozniak: The Visionary and the Engineer.

hook.text: Steve Jobs couldn't code. Wozniak didn't care about marketing. Together they built the most valuable company ever.

buildup.text: Wozniak built the Apple I alone â€” a technical marvel. Jobs saw what Wozniak couldn't: a product people would buy.

discovery.text: Their partnership thrived on tension. Wozniak wanted open systems; Jobs demanded control and polish.

twist.text: By 1985, Jobs was fired from his own company. Wozniak had already left. The partnership lasted just 9 years.

climax.text: Their brief collaboration defined personal computing. Neither would have changed the world alone.

punchline.text: The best partnerships fuse what neither person could do alone.

quiz.question: What was Steve Wozniak's primary role in Apple's founding?
options: Building the hardware and writing the software
